articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — The property manager of Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate made his first court appearance on Monday on charges in the classified documents case against the former president but did not enter a plea because he has not found a Florida-based attorney to represent him.
articles.title: Mar-a-Lago manager De Oliveira makes his first court appearance in Trump's classified documents case

articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN
articles.description: At about summer's halfway point, the record-breaking heat and weather extremes are both unprecedented and unsurprising, hellish yet boring in some ways, scientists say.
articles.title: Here's how hot and extreme the summer has been, and it's only halfway over

articles.author: REBECCA BOONE
articles.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — Idaho mother Lori Vallow Daybell has been sentenced to life in prison without parole Monday in the murders of her two youngest children and a romantic rival in a case that included bizarre claims that her son and daughter were zombies and that she was a goddess sent to usher in the Biblical apocalypse.
articles.title: Idaho mom Lori Vallow Daybell sentenced in deaths of 2 children and her romantic rival

articles.author: MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A man who was a Princeton University student when the FBI arrested him on charges related to the U.S. Capitol riot pleaded guilty on Monday to joining a mob's attack on police officers during one of the most violent clashes on Jan.
articles.title: Princeton University student pleads guilty to joining mob's attack on Capitol

articles.author: LAURAN NEERGAARD
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The National Institutes of Health is beginning a handful of studies to test possible treatments for long COVID, an anxiously awaited step in U.S. efforts against the mysterious condition that afflicts millions.
articles.title: Brain fog and other long COVID symptoms are the focus of new small treatment studies

articles.author: ANDREW DALTON
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Paul Reubens, the actor and comedian whose Pee-wee Herman character — an overgrown child with a tight gray suit and an unforgettable laugh — became a 1980s pop cultural phenomenon, has died at 70.
articles.title: Pee-wee Herman actor and creator Paul Reubens dies from cancer at 70

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden has decided to keep U.S. Space Command headquarters in Colorado, overturning a last-ditch decision by the Trump administration to move it to Alabama and ending months of politically fueled debate, according to senior U.S.
articles.title: Biden has decided to keep Space Command in Colorado, rejecting move to Alabama, officials tell AP

articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel's Supreme Court said Monday that a full panel of 15 justices would hear petitions in September against a contentious law that was passed last week by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government and which has spurred mass protests.
articles.title: Israel's full high court to hear petitions against judiciary law in September that spurred protests

articles.author: ANWARULLAH KHAN and RIAZ KHAN
articles.description: KHAR, Pakistan (AP) — An Afghan branch of Islamic State on Monday claimed responsibility for a suicide bombing in Pakistan that killed at least 54 people at a pro-Taliban party's election rally, in one of the region's worst attacks in recent years.
articles.title: IS claims responsibility for the bombing that killed 54 at a pro-Taliban election rally in Pakistan

articles.author: BY WYATTE GRANTHAM-PHILIPS
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Trucking company Yellow Corp. has shut down operations and is headed for a bankruptcy filing, according to the Teamsters Union and multiple media reports.
articles.title: Yellow is shutting down and headed for bankruptcy, the Teamsters Union says. Here's what to know
